title: Andrew Pierce for the Daily Mail
text: ANDREW PIERCE: One might think Michael Dobbs, the Tory Party's most successful British author since Jeffrey Archer, was spoilt for choice when seeking inspiration for Francis Urquhart. The scheming anti-hero of the House Of Cards trilogy - known for his catchphrase 'you might very well think that; I couldn't possibly comment' - became a household name when played by Ian Richardson on BBC1 in the early 1990s. Asked who Urquhart was based on, Dobbs yesterday said: 'I worked with a number of interesting politicians in my time.' But the Tory peer did reveal one person inspired him to write about the shady character: Margaret Thatcher (pictured). ...read
